title: 2026 NFL Mock Draft roundup: 7 names for Patriots fans to know entering combine week
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots hold No. 31 pick in 2026 NFL Draft; focus likely on offensive line or edge rusher.
Oregon tight end Kenyon Sadiq is a potential pick, noted for his strong pass-catching ability.
Missouri's Zion Young and Illinois's Gabe Jacas are potential edge rusher picks for Patriots.

title: Team USA writes a new chapter and other takeaways from gold-medal triumph over Canada
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Team USA men's hockey wins Olympic gold, their first since 1980, defeating Canada 2-1 in Milan.
Jack Hughes scores the overtime goal for Team USA, while Connor Hellebuyck stops 41 shots in goal.
Matt Boldy opens scoring for the U.S.; Canada ties game in a second period dominated by their offense.

title: 5 takeaways from the Revolution’s season-opening defeat in Nashville
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: New England Revolution lost 4-1 to Nashville SC in the 2026 MLS season opener at Geodis Park.
Three projected starting defenders were absent, impacting Revolution's defensive performance under new head coach Marko Mitrović.
Revolution's lone goal came from Leo Campana, assisted by Carles Gil; the team struggled to create scoring opportunities.

title: New Commuter Rail fare gates at South Station break down again
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: New Commuter Rail fare gates at South Station faced breakdowns twice due to harsh winter conditions.
Keolis reports wind and snow have significantly impacted fare gate operation, prompting protective measures and design reassessment.
Despite issues, fare gate installation has led to a 42% increase in mTicket activations compared to last year.

title: Watch: Jack Hughes delivers USA first Olympic gold medal in men’s hockey since 1980, team honors Johnny Gaudreau
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jack Hughes scored the game-winning goal in USA's 2-1 overtime victory against Canada for the 2026 Olympic gold.
Team USA honored late Johnny Gaudreau by celebrating with his jersey and including his children in the team photo.
Bruins defenseman Charlie McAvoy and goalie Jeremy Swayman won gold with Team USA, marking Boston's first Olympic golds since 2014.

title: After homering in spring training debut, could Andruw Monasterio play big role for Red Sox in 2026?
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Andruw Monasterio hit a 368-foot home run in the Red Sox' Grapefruit League opener against the Twins.
Monasterio, acquired from the Brewers, is competing for a primary infield position due to his hitting and versatility.
Red Sox manager Alex Cora praised Monasterio's athleticism and potential to replace injured infielder Romy Gonzalez.

title: MSP arrests Maine man after he allegedly crashed truck twice while on drugs
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Andrew Beaulieu, 30, was arrested after crashing his truck twice in Massachusetts while allegedly under the influence of drugs.
Beaulieu's truck first crashed into a Burger King's entrance in Bridgewater; an hour later, it crashed again in Westport.
Police found synthetic cannabinoids in Beaulieu's truck, leading to his charges and arrest for drug possession and DUI.

title: Methuen woman searching for her wedding dress after dry cleaner mix-up
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Kathleen Shea Dunleavy from Methuen is searching for her missing wedding dress after a dry cleaning mix-up 15 years ago.
Dunleavy recently discovered she has been holding another bride's gown and is asking for help via social media to find hers.
The missing gown features buttons down the back, a flower appliqué, and blue initials 'KS' embroidered inside.

title: At Chevalier Theatre, Mavis Staples lives up to her legacy of joy and protest
author: Terence Cawley
bullets: Mavis Staples performed at Chevalier Theatre, Medford, showcasing her gospel-soul roots with a blend of protest and joy.
The 86-year-old strategically conserved energy during the 12-song set, with notable tracks like 'Freedom Highway' and 'Respect Yourself'.
Staples balanced joyful moments with pointed social commentary, including remarks on ICE and women's rights during her performance.

title: Here’s how the Red Sox plan on handling MLB’s new ABS challenging system
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Boston Red Sox's Wilson Contreras successfully used MLB's new ABS challenge system in spring training.
Each MLB team will have two challenges per game for pitches, retaining them if successful.
Red Sox manager Alex Cora supports the ABS system, allowing players to challenge balls and strikes.
